Bioc/AnVIL training

Bioc/AnVIL team

June 17, 2021

training.Rmd

Bioc/AnVIL training

Beginner

  • Get started with Bioconductor in AnVIL
  • Terra / AnVIL R / Bioconductor Popup Workshops
    • Week 1: Using R / Bioconductor in AnVIL (video) with Martin Morgan
    • Week 2: The R / Bioconductor AnVIL package (video) with Martin Morgan and Nitesh Turaga
    • Week 3: Running a Workflow (video) with Martin Morgan and Kayla Interdonato
    • Week 4: Single-cell RNASeq with ‘Orchestrating Single Cell Analysis’ in R / Bioconductor (video) with Vince Carey
    • Week 5: Using AnVIL for Teaching R (video) with Levi Waldron
    • Week 6: Reproducible Research with AnVILPublish (video) with Martin Morgan
    • Week 7: Participant Stories (video)

Workspaces

See illustrative examples of how you can use Bioconductor in AnVIL workspaces.

  • The AnVIL package
    • Simplifies exploration of the Terra data model
    • Supports programmatic development of workflows, workspaces, and resource management data
  • Orchestrating Single Cell Analysis
    • Describes how to use a custom container to do all computations in the OSCA book [current to March 2021]
    • Note: another workspace processes the book content via AnVILPublish
  • RNA-seq analysis with DESeq2
    • A collection of Jupyter notebooks
    • Includes a WDL workflow that runs salmon quantification on FASTQ inputs
  • Pan-cancer Transcriptome Surveys
    • Two workflows, each devoted to different gene sets
    • The WDL and scripts are registered at dockstore.org
    • Unit testing for the script components are managed in BiocOncoTK

Notebooks

  • Using Bioconductor’s VCF processing stack to demonstrate population stratification using a small slice of chr17 from EBI 1000 genomes VCF
  • Using Dockstore and Terra for Pan-cancer Transcriptomics to compare relationships between gene expression and stratified or continuous measures of microsatellite instability in 33 TCGA tumor types

Miscellaneous

  • Shiny Apps
    • TerraPlane filters Dockstore to find methods based on search terms
  • Data Management Utilities
    • R Markdown for Using Terra to Survey CCDG and CMG ?
